message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "The research is based on the World Bank Enterprise Survey conducted in multiple countries in the past decade.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed data from the Food and Agriculture Organization Corporate Statistical Database to explore the trends of olive oil export from Tunisia.", "dataset": ["Food and Agriculture Organization Corporate Statistical Database"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes data from the International Energy Agency on global energy use and greenhouse gas emissions.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We combined data from the Global Terrorism Database and various economic indicators to investigate the potential impacts of terrorism on foreign direct investments.", "dataset": ["Global Terrorism Database"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "We employ two datasets - the Human Capital Index and the Program for International Student Assessment (PISA) - to examine the state of education in Asia.", "dataset": ["Human Capital Index", "Program for International Student Assessment (PISA)"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "The paper uses household survey data from the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture to assess the effectiveness of agricultural interventions in Malawi.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This analysis combines data from the World Development Indicators and the International Telecommunication Union to investigate the relationship between mobile phone usage and economic growth in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "International Telecommunication Union"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We examined the correlation between air pollution and population health using data from the Demographic and Health Survey and the Global Burden of Disease Study.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey", "Global Burden of Disease Study"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "The study uses two datasets - the World Bank Private Participation in Infrastructure database and the International Energy Agency's Access to Electricity Database - to evaluate the impact of private investment on energy access in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank Private Participation in Infrastructure database", "International Energy Agency's Access to Electricity Database"], "topic": ["Energy", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We investigate the effects of trade openness on income inequality using data from the World Income Inequality Database and the World Trade Organization's Services Trade Restrictiveness Index.", "dataset": ["World Income Inequality Database", "World Trade Organization's Services Trade Restrictiveness Index"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Trade"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "The research is based on the World Bank Enterprise Survey conducted in multiple countries in the past decade.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed data from the Food and Agriculture Organization Corporate Statistical Database to explore the trends of olive oil export from Tunisia.", "dataset": ["Food and Agriculture Organization Corporate Statistical Database"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes data from the International Energy Agency on global energy use and greenhouse gas emissions.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We combined data from the Global Terrorism Database and various economic indicators to investigate the potential impacts of terrorism on foreign direct investments.", "dataset": ["Global Terrorism Database"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "We employ two datasets - the World Bank Private Participation in Infrastructure database and the International Energy Agency's Access to Electricity Database - to evaluate the impact of private investment on energy access in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank Private Participation in Infrastructure database", "International Energy Agency's Access to Electricity Database"], "topic": ["Energy", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We investigate the effects of trade openness on income inequality using data from the World Income Inequality Database and the World Trade Organization's Services Trade Restrictiveness Index.", "dataset": ["World Income Inequality Database", "World Trade Organization's Services Trade Restrictiveness Index"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Trade"]}]
